parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post does not contain a CMF number. While the absence of a CMF number is not automatically disqualifying, it suggests the post might not be directly linked to official electoral campaign materials.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post refers to Manolache Vasile, a senatorial candidate.  The phrase "Pe 1 decembrie, invit cetățenii județului Bistrița-Năsăud să facă pasul spre lumină" directly encourages voting for the candidate, implicitly linking the act of voting with a positive outcome ("pasul spre lumină"). The hashtags #ManolacheVasileSenator and #SchimbarePentruRomânia further reinforce this connection. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, targeting a wide audience within Bistrița-Năsăud County and beyond, as evidenced by the reach estimate (100K-500K) and the specified location targeting in the `aaa_info` section. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to encourage voters in Bistrița-Năsăud County to vote for Manolache Vasile. The call to action ("Hai să votăm pentru un viitor diferit") and the overall message directly aim to influence voting behavior. This clearly fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. While it uses a metaphor (Plato's cave), it's not presenting factual information or analysis in a neutral manner. The clear call to action and focus on a specific candidate disqualifies it from being considered journalistic.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post is not expressing a personal opinion; it's a clear and direct appeal for votes for a specific candidate. The use of persuasive language and imagery is designed to sway voters, not simply express a viewpoint.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1226606971778404</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by Momentum Motion Pictures SRL, promotes Manolache Vasile's senatorial candidacy.  The post uses persuasive language and imagery to encourage voters to support him.  The targeting of the ad, the call to action, and the explicit mention of the candidate and the election date all point towards an intention to influence the vote.  While the post uses a metaphor, its core message is a clear appeal for votes, making it electoral propaganda. The post's end date (1732953600) is after the election day, which is a violation.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Manolache Vasile</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>MOMENTUM</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Momentum Motion Pictures SRL, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei reclame plătite pe Facebook (ID postare: 1226606971778404) care promovează candidatura lui Manolache Vasile la Senat, folosind un limbaj persuasiv și imagini menite să influențeze votul alegătorilor din județul Bistrița-Năsăud.  Reclama, cu o estimare a audienței de 100.000-500.000 de persoane, conține îndemnuri directe la vot ("Hai să votăm pentru un viitor diferit") și asociază votul pentru Manolache Vasile cu un rezultat pozitiv ("pasul spre lumină").  Această reclamă, prin conținutul și scopul său, constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei de campanie, având un efect electoral clar asupra voturilor obținute de candidatul Manolache Vasile.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
